treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Cynareae;genus Cirsium;species eatonii;variety viperinum;
treatment.description: Stems erect or ascending, 25–40 cm. Leaf faces glabrous or nearly so. Heads 1–5, subsessile or short-pedunculate, in erect, racemiform or corymbiform arrays. Involucres 3–5 cm, thinly arachnoid with non-septate trichomes, individual phyllaries evident. Phyllaries green or purplish-tinged; outer with numerous lateral spines; apical spines stout. Corollas lavender to purple, 29–35 mm, tubes 9–12.5 mm, throats 9–12 mm, lobes 9–11 mm. Pappi 20–25 mm.

habitat_info.text: rocky subalpine slopes , open bristlecone pine forests ;

treatment.discussion: Variety viperinum is apparently endemic to upper elevations of the Snake Range of White Pine County, Nevada. Heads of var. viperinum are similar in size to those of var. clokeyi. These taxa can be distinguished readily by the features in the key. Ranges of the two varieties are separated by about 340 km. Hybridization with Cirsium inamoenum is suspected based upon apparently intermediate specimens.
